name: No Player's Allowed! There's no game here, go away!
name_original: No Player's Allowed! There's no game here, go away!
description:
This was for my MMU Game A Week game jam second theme, 'Indirect Control'.

The premise originated with the player spawning in a terrible maze, with the NPC's talking about you behind your back, but it wasn't exactly "indirect control" so I changed the player to be on a set path, being taken out of the maze by an NPC callled Officer Bucket! (He's an officer in a bucket (the NPCs removed all weapons in the game to stop you killing them)).

So it is more or less a cutscene, you only have control of your camera, Officer Bucket moves you out of the game "NPC Murder Party" now painted over and titled "No Player's Allowed! There is no game here, go away!"

I'm not too happy with it but I am happy to give myself a crash course in using Unity and dabbling in some mini NPC AI behaviours.
